sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
Asymptotic Estimate of $N_A^p(n)$ when $A$ is a Finite Set

rag.query_raw:
\label{iden-3} We have
(a)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n}N^p_A(k)\omega(n-k)=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\tau_A(k)\left(q_{\mathbb N-A}^e(n-k)-q_{\mathbb N-A}^o(n-k)\right), \]
(b)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^n(-1)^{n-k}N^q_A(k)o(n-k)=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\tau_A^s(k)\left(p_{\mathbb N-A}^e(n-k)-p_{\mathbb N-A}^o(n-k)\right). \]
rag.query_normalized: \label iden-3 we have (a) \[ \sum_ k=1 ^ n n^p_a(k)\omega(n-k)=\sum_ k=1 ^ n \tau_a(k)\left(q_ \mathbb n-a ^e(n-k)-q_ \mathbb n-a ^o(n-k)\right), \] (b) \[ \sum_ k=1 ^n(-1)^ n-k n^q_a(k)o(n-k)=\sum_ k=1 ^ n \tau_a^s(k)\left(p_ \mathbb n-a ^e(n-k)-p_ \mathbb n-a ^o(n-k)\right). \]

theorem_statement:
\label{iden-3} We have
(a)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^{n}N^p_A(k)\omega(n-k)=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\tau_A(k)\left(q_{\mathbb N-A}^e(n-k)-q_{\mathbb N-A}^o(n-k)\right), \]
(b)  \[ \sum_{k=1}^n(-1)^{n-k}N^q_A(k)o(n-k)=\sum_{k=1}^{n}\tau_A^s(k)\left(p_{\mathbb N-A}^e(n-k)-p_{\mathbb N-A}^o(n-k)\right). \]
generated_proof:
### Proof Sketch
- Start from the inversion identities (Theorem 2): the generating functions for N_A^p and N_A^q multiplied, respectively, by the parity-difference generating functions for distinct partitions and for ordinary partitions over A, yield the divisor-sum series τ_A and τ_A^s.
- Factor the universal Euler product over all positive integers into the product over A and its complement N−A; this lets us replace q_A^e−q_A^o by ω convolved with q_{N−A}^e−q_{N−A}^o, and similarly replace p_A^e−p_A^o by the factor corresponding to O(−x), where O encodes distinct-odd partitions.
- Concretely, for (a), multiply the generating-function identity F_A(x)·G_A(x)=Σ τ_A(n)x^n (with G_A=∏_{a∈A}(1−x^a)) by H_{N−A}(x)=∏_{b∈N−A}(1−x^b). Since G_A·H_{N−A}=∏_{n≥1}(1−x^n)=Σ ω(n)x^n, coefficient extraction yields the stated convolution.
- For (b), write F_A^q(x)·P_A(x)=Σ τ_A^s(n)x^n, where P_A=∏_{a∈A}(1+x^a)^{-1}=Σ (p_A^e−p_A^o)(n)x^n. Multiply both sides by P_{N−A}(x)=∏_{b∈N−A}(1+x^b)^{-1}.
- Use the identity P_A·P_{N−A}=1/∏_{n≥1}(1+x^n)=∏_{odd r≥1}(1−x^r)=O(−x), with O(x)=∏_{odd r≥1}(1+x^r)=Σ o(n)x^n. Coefficient extraction then yields the claimed signed convolution.
- The sign (−1)^{n−k} on the left of (b) arises from evaluating O at −x.

### Proof
We work with formal power series throughout. For a subset S⊆N, set
- G_S(x)=∑_{m≥0}(q_S^e(m)−q_S^o(m))x^m=∏_{s∈S}(1−x^s); this is standard from the parity-marked generating function for distinct partitions over S.
- P_S(x)=∑_{m≥0}(p_S^e(m)−p_S^o(m))x^m=∏_{s∈S}(1+x^s)^{-1}; this is standard from the parity-marked generating
